resources.string: For information on usage, please see the Usage menu.

- Ensure to specify multiplication, for example (7*x) in place of 7x.

- To calculate the root after a given number of iterations, set the tolerance to 0.

- If you wish to calculate an exact root, set the iterations to 0.

- These can be used together, for example calculate the root after X iterations or to within a tolerance of X.

- If using both, try to ensure your function has a root at 0. There is a check, but it's not infallible.

There are several things you should know when using this app, as it's still not perfect:

- When using a tolerance of 0, and a max iterations of 0 the calculation will repeat for a huge number of iterations if no exact root is found. To avoid doing this, try to ensure you have a root within a reasonable amount of iterations. To avoid infinite loops (division by 0), the tolerance is set minutely to be as close as possible, eliminating this risk.

- If the calculation is going to take more than 500 iterations, a "Please wait…" message will appear to let you know it's going to take a little longer. This shouldn't need to occur on most calculations though.

- When typing in multiplications, ensure to use (7*x) instead of 7x. This doesn't apply to cos(x) etc.

- Intervals including negative numbers work just fine, there was originally a bug in the parser.

- If you want to calculate the number of iterations needed to find the root within a specified accuracy, tap on the "Iterations" button and input your data as normal, but leave the Max Iterations as 0 then calculate.

- When using 'e', you can should use the typical exp(x) form, I still need to add parser support for 'e'.

- If you spot any bugs, email me with a screenshot of the equation/interval/iterations/tolerance you're trying to use so I can replicate the issue.

- If you need any other help, you can always contact me via the link in the About page.

This app started as a utility for myself to check my bisection calculations, but I decided it was probably of use to people as a quick way to check or calculate bisection results. I may add more features in future, but I feel it functions nicely and smoothly as it is now. If you want to say thanks for this app, you can donate to show your appreciation.
